Animal¶

The Animal class with Herbivores and Carnivores as subclasses of Animal.

class biosim.Animal.Animal(age=0, weight=None)[source]¶

The animal class with Herbivores and carnivores.

Parameters:

  • age (int) –

  • weight (float or int) –

die()[source]¶

Method to decide if the animal die with certainty if weight is 0 and with a probability

..math::

probability = omega * (1 - fitness)

Return type:

True if animal dies and False if animals do not die.

property fitness¶

Method to return fitness of the animal. This is a property method so each time the weight or age changes, the fitness is updated.

Return type:

Fitness of the animals

classmethod fitness_calculation(age, weight, parameter)[source]¶

Method to calculate the fitness of the animals

Parameters:

  • age (int) –

  • weight (int or float) –

  • parameter (dictionary) –

Return type:

The fitness of the specific animal.

static fitness_formula(plus_minus, x, x_half, phi_x)[source]¶

Method to return the formula to be used in fitness calculation

Parameters:

  • plus_minus (1 or -1) –

  • x (int or float) – age or weight

  • x_half (int or float) – a_half or w_half

  • phi_x (int or float) – phi_age or phi_weight

Return type:

Formula to be used in fitness calculation

growth_per_year()[source]¶

Method to increase the age by 1 each year

migrate(neighbors)[source]¶

Method to determine if the animal migrates. The animals migrate with probability mu * fitness Animals migrate to four adjacent cells at random with equal probability.

Parameters:

neighbors – list of cells where animals can migrate

Return type:

True if animals migrate otherwise false.

procreate(N)[source]¶

Method to calculate if the animal has given birth. If the animal has given birth, it creates an instance of the class (object ) of Herbivore or the carnivore as baby animal.

The weight of the baby is calculated random log normal distribution with w_birth and sigma_birth from following formula:

Parameters:

N (N is the number of Herbivores in the cell at the start of the breeding season) –

Returns:

Boolean value of animal has given birth or not and baby animal object

Return type:

Tuple

classmethod set_params(params)[source]¶

Method to set the parameter of the specific class.

Parameters:

params (dictionary) –

classmethod update_para(params)[source]¶
Method to check for unknown parameters and raises value error if the parameters are not in

animal parameters.

Parameters:

params (dictionary) – new params

weight_loss_per_year()[source]¶

Method to lose weight each year by the formula: weight * eta

class biosim.Animal.Carnivores(age=0, weight=None)[source]¶

Carnivore animals hunts and eats Herbivores. Carnivores can reside in Desert, Lowland and Highland

Parameters:

  • age (int) –

  • weight (float or int) –

die()¶

Method to decide if the animal die with certainty if weight is 0 and with a probability

..math::

probability = omega * (1 - fitness)

Return type:

True if animal dies and False if animals do not die.

eat(animal_list)[source]¶
Method to get the list of herbivore animals that are eaten by carnivore animals. The weight

of the carnivore animal increases by beta * amount F. The carnivore will continue to kill herbivore until it has eaten amount F or has tried to kill all herbivore in a cell. The carnivore will kill herbivore with probability: 0 if fitness of carnivore <= fitness of herbivore (carnivore fitness - herbivore fitness)/ delta phi max if carnivore fitness - herbivore fitness < delta phi max 1 otherwise

Parameters:

animal_list (list) – Herbivore animal list in a cell

Return type:

List of Herbivore animals that are eaten

property fitness¶

Method to return fitness of the animal. This is a property method so each time the weight or age changes, the fitness is updated.

Return type:

Fitness of the animals

classmethod fitness_calculation(age, weight, parameter)¶

Method to calculate the fitness of the animals

Parameters:

  • age (int) –

  • weight (int or float) –

  • parameter (dictionary) –

Return type:

The fitness of the specific animal.

static fitness_formula(plus_minus, x, x_half, phi_x)¶

Method to return the formula to be used in fitness calculation

Parameters:

  • plus_minus (1 or -1) –

  • x (int or float) – age or weight

  • x_half (int or float) – a_half or w_half

  • phi_x (int or float) – phi_age or phi_weight

Return type:

Formula to be used in fitness calculation

growth_per_year()¶

Method to increase the age by 1 each year

hunt(animal_list)[source]¶
Method to determine the list of the herbivore animals that can be hunted. Carnivore

animal hunts herbivores in the order of the least fitness.

Parameters:

animal_list (list) – Herbivore list in the cell in weight ascending order

Return type:

list of herbivore animals that can be hunted.

migrate(neighbors)¶

Method to determine if the animal migrates. The animals migrate with probability mu * fitness Animals migrate to four adjacent cells at random with equal probability.

Parameters:

neighbors – list of cells where animals can migrate

Return type:

True if animals migrate otherwise false.

procreate(N)¶

Method to calculate if the animal has given birth. If the animal has given birth, it creates an instance of the class (object ) of Herbivore or the carnivore as baby animal.

The weight of the baby is calculated random log normal distribution with w_birth and sigma_birth from following formula:

Parameters:

N (N is the number of Herbivores in the cell at the start of the breeding season) –

Returns:

Boolean value of animal has given birth or not and baby animal object

Return type:

class biosim.Animal.Herbivores(age=0, weight=None)[source]¶

Herbivore animals eats fodder and can reside in the Lowland, Highland and Desert although Dessert does not have any fodder

Parameters:

  • age (int) –

  • weight (float or int) –

die()¶

Method to decide if the animal die with certainty if weight is 0 and with a probability

..math::

probability = omega * (1 - fitness)

Return type:

True if animal dies and False if animals do not die.

eat()[source]¶

Method to increase the weight of the herbivore after the animal eats. The weight of the herbivore animal increases by beta * amount F of fodder

property fitness¶

Method to return fitness of the animal. This is a property method so each time the weight or age changes, the fitness is updated.

Return type:

Fitness of the animals

Method to calculate the fitness of the animals
